title: 2 killed in New Zealand construction site shooting, suspect also dead: Police
description: Two people were killed after a gunman opened fire at a construction site in Auckland, New Zealand, police said.

title: No drug test for 'Rust' movie armorer in upcoming trial over fatal shooting
description: The former weapons supervisor on the set of the movie “Rust” won’t have to take a drug test as she confronts charges of evidence tampering and involuntary manslaughter in the shooting death of a cinematographer by actor Alec Baldwin

title: Judge rejects Trump's request to move hush-money case into federal court
description: A federal judge in New York has rejected former President Donald Trump's request to move his hush-money criminal case into federal court.

title: Powerball jackpot surges to game's 3rd largest prize ever
description: The Powerball jackpot surged to $1 billion for Wednesday night's drawing.

title: Stanford University president to resign following concerns about his research
description: Stanford University President Marc Tessier-Lavigne says he will resign following concerns about the integrity of his research

title: Veteran who stormed Capitol with loaded pistol is sentenced to 7 years in prison
description: A military veteran who stormed the U.S. Capitol with a loaded pistol, metal-plated body armor and a gas mask has been sentenced to seven years in prison

title: Inside the ongoing staffing crisis at 911 dispatch centers
description: With nearly one in four seats empty at 911 dispatch centers since 2019, some public safety communications centers say they're battling a crisis.

title: Maine governor expands access to abortion later in pregnancy
description: Maine will soon expand abortion access, joining a half dozen states that leave it to doctors and patients to make the decision without restrictions on timing

title: 'I was terrified': Women suing Texas over abortion bans give emotional testimony
description: Women suing Texas over its abortion ban appear in court to testify as part of a daylong hearing. They claim their lives were put at risk due to the bans.

title: Kenya rocked by nationwide anti-government protests over finance bill raising gas tax
description: 3-day protests have been called by Kenya’s opposition over a contentious finance bill, and the rising cost of living

title: Owners of salvage rights to honor man who dedicated life to exploring the Titanic
description: The company that owns the salvage rights to the wreck of the Titanic is holding a virtual memorial for one of the world’s foremost experts about the ship a month after he died with four others in a submersible implosion

title: No evidence of toddler walking down highway in Carlee Russell case: Police
description: Carlee Russell called 911 to report a toddler walking down the highway before she went missing for two days, but police said they found no evidence of the reported child.

title: Man wrongly convicted in 1994 fatal shooting of a baby sues the city, police
description: A 51-year-old Connecticut man who was exonerated after serving 28 years in prison for the fatal shooting of a baby in 1994 has filed a lawsuit against the city of New Haven and six now-former police officers involved in his arrest

title: WATCH:  Dust storm towers over Phoenix area
description: The first dust storm of the season struck the Phoenix area on Monday.

title: Judge denies Trump's request for new trial in E. Jean Carroll case
description: A federal judge in New York has denied former President Trump's request for a new trial in the defamation and battery case brought by the writer E. Jean Carroll.

title: WATCH:  Dolphin hassles swimmers at beach in Japan
description: Swimmers at a beach in Japan got a little more than they bargained for when a dolphin seemingly hassled multiple people in the water.

title: UK Prime Minister Sunak apologizes for ban on LGBTQ+ people in the military
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has apologized for the treatment of gay veterans, saying a previous ban on LGBTQ+ people serving in the U_K_ military was “an appalling failure of the British state.”

title: Defense wants trial in attack against Nancy Pelosi's husband moved from San Francisco
description: The man charged in last year’s attack against former U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s husband is scheduled to appear in federal court Wednesday to request the trial be moved out of San Francisco

title: Women denied abortions in Texas ask court for clarity over state's exceptions to ban
description: Women who sued Texas after saying they were denied abortions despite serious risks to their health are asking a court to step in

title: What we know about the American soldier detained in North Korea
description: An American soldier who had just been released from a South Korean prison fled across the border to North Korea where he was detained and remains in custody.

title: 15 die by electrocution after transformer explodes in northern India
description: Fifteen people including six policer officers have died by electrocution after a transformer exploded near a sewage treatment plant in northern India

title: China prepares for naval drills with Russia in sign of continuing support amid war
description: China says it's navy ships are preparing for joint exercises with Russia's sea forces in a sign of Beijing's continuing support for Moscow's invasion of neighboring Ukraine

title: 'Sticky Note Bandit' robs 4th Houston bank in 2 weeks, FBI says
description: A man dressed as a woman walked into four banks in Texas this month and handed tellers demands for cash scrawled on sticky notes, the FBI said.

title: Britain’s MI6 intelligence chief says AI won’t replace the need for human spies
description: The head of Britain’s MI6 intelligence agency says British spies are already using artificial intelligence to hamper the supply of weapons to Russia

title: UK inflation falls by more than anticipated to 15-month low of 7.9%
description: Inflation in the U.K. has fallen by more than anticipated to a 15-month low a development that may ease the pressure for the Bank of England to raise interest rates sharply over the coming months, to the potential relief of struggling households

title: Drug overdose deaths involving cocaine and opioids have spiked in last decade: CDC
description: A new CDC report published Wednesday found the overdose death rate involving cocaine and opioids increased seven-fold over the last decade.

title: WATCH:  Domesticated rabbits invade South Florida neighborhood
description: A South Florida neighborhood is dealing with a growing group of domesticated rabbits on its streets after a breeder illegally let hers loose.

title: Ford plant in Missouri shuts down over 'possible threat,' sheriff's office says
description: A Ford assembly plant in Missouri was evacuated and shut down after police received a report about a possible threat on Tuesday night.

title: First-gen iPhone sells at auction for $190K — about 380 times its original price
description: A first-generation iPhone has sold at auction for $190,373, roughly 380 times its original price of $499 when it went for sale in 2007

title: A strong 6.5-magnitude earthquake in the Pacific Ocean shakes Central America
description: A powerful 6.5 magnitude earthquake in the Pacific Ocean off the coast of El Salvador has shaken much of Central America from Nicaragua to Guatemala, sending residents in some cities streaming into the streets

title: Alaska man inadvertently films his own drowning on a glacial lake, officials say
description: Authorities say an Alaska man inadvertently filmed his own drowning on a glacial lake with a GoPro camera mounted on his helmet

title: Biden camp admonishes DeSantis' culture war fights as a 'contrived political stunt'
description: President Joe Biden’s campaign slammed Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis’ culture war platform as a “contrived political stunt.”

title: Idaho college killings: Prosecutors dispute DNA could have been planted at scene
description: Prosecutors in the Idaho college murders trial disputed a claim by Bryan Kohberger's defense attorneys, who said the suspect's DNA could have been planted at the scene.
